item.title: Report X-2023100691
item.description:
Report X-2023100691

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-05
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100691 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND RIPPED/TORN OPEN. ONE OF THE CONTENTS CAP IS CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. CONTETNS ARE REGULATED AND PKG IS UNDECLARED. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: ONE OF THE CONTENTS CAP IS CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. 2. X-2023100694 NO COMMENTS PROVIDED.

  • City: SACRAMENTO

  • Description: 1. X-2023100690 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND RIPPED/TORN OPEN. ALL CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREAD WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODED AWAY. PKG IS UNDECLARED. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: ALL CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREAD WITH THE SEAL UNDERNEATH CORRODED AWAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. 2. X-2023100692 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE CAME FROM UNLOAD WET AND RIPPED/TORN OPEN. TWO OF THE CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEALS UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: TWO OF THE CONTENTS CAPS ARE CROSS THREADED WITH THE SEALS UNDERNEATH CORRODING AWAY. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: SPILL WAS CLEANED AND PKG PLACED IN A HAZMAT BAG.

item.title: Report X-2023100682
item.description:
Report X-2023100682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100682 SequenceEvent: Package was torn on one side, and around that tear, discoloration is significantly obvious. Inside were 4 quantities of 1 qt Steris Spor-Klenz Concentrate, each inside a plastic bag. Inside that plastic bag, liquid can be seen out of the bottle evident of a leakage on all them DescribePack: Cap is loose about a quarter of a turn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from the trailer, placed in a plastic lined container and wiped down any spills. 2. X-2023100912 SequenceEvent: Shipment exterior packaging was wet on one corner on its underside and removed from the sort stream. It was put into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: One of the four bottles had a finger loose cap on it. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using neutral absorbent materials, while the rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container.

item.title: Report X-2023100662
item.description:
Report X-2023100662

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler noticed hazmat package was leaking and informed direct manager right away. Manager placed leaky hazmat inside a hazmat tote with absorbent, and used absorbent to clean up spill on floor. QA was then called to collect the item safely. DescribePack: The top cap's plastic seal broke on the bottle and caused cap to come loose and leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leaky hazmat package was placed inside a hazmat tote with absorbent to stop source of leak, and absorbent was used to clean up spill on floor.

item.title: Report X-2023100369
item.description:
Report X-2023100369

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-04
  • City: COSTA MESA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 10/04/2023 at approximatelty 1207, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 475551 at the station location in Costa Mesa, reporting a non-hazardous spill. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box, containing a Throttle Body air intake cleaner at 12 ounces, Prestone power steering fluid at 32 ounces, Purple power cleaner and degreaser trigger spray at 40 ounces, and Purple Power cleaner and degreaser liquid at 1 gallon, which leaked partially. Further investigation revealed that the Throttle Body air intake cleaner is an aerosol container that was being shipped under the Limited quantiy exception under FedEx Extra Hours program. The shipment is being held for further disposition instructions.

WHEN RESPONDER RESPONDED, LOOKED AT THE SHIPPING PAPERS TO CONFIRM HAZMAT AND NOTICED PACKAGE WAS WET FROM THE OUTSIDE BOTTOM OF THE PACKAGE. RESPONDER REMOVED THE PACKAGE FROM THE TRAILER AND BROUGHT IT TO THE DMP AREA.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED FROM TRAILER 818094 FROM 958-SACR. DESTINATION STATION 954-SROS UNLOADED PACKAGE FROM DOOR 5 WHEN A PACKAGE HANDLER FOUND PACKAGE WAS WET AND IT WAS PUT INTO A HAZMAT BAGGED TOTE. PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA AT 8:47 AM. PACKAGE BROUGHT TO DAMAGED HAZMAT PROCESSING ARE FOR INVESTIGATION DescribePack: ITEM HAD LOOSE CAP WHICH LED TO CONTENTS SPILLING. NO CRACKS IN THE CONTAINER WERE FOUND DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO HAZMAT BAGGED TOTE

item.title: Report E-2023110085
item.description:
Report E-2023110085

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-26
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 26, 2023, eight (8) 1-gallon containers of UN1219 were crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. PES personnel collected the eight (8) damaged pails of UN1219 and containerized them in one (1) 55-gallon drum. Crews then deployed granular absorbents and worked them in using hand tools. All UN1219 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023100590

  • City: OCEANSIDE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment external packaging was discolored on two sides, top, and bottom. Although the exterior packaging had the UN packaging markings it did not have the max weight /PSI ratings on its surface. The outer packaging was also a reused box from the original manufacturer, BD. The inner container inner packaging, a bag had smeared lettering on its side indicative of leakage. Item was removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container for inspection. The material weight was listed at 9 lbs. , entire package weighed 7 pounds. DescribePack: Inner container had signs that it had leaked but not from the tight closure on it. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The shipment was removed from the sort stream for inspection and put into a plastic lined container.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: A Package Handler informed management of a a weird smell coming out of the box. Management informed the admin of this. This package was then brought to the hazmat cage and ISF and DPR were completed. DescribePack: One of the paint cans had a puncture on it due to the handling of the package. The package also lacked any protection within the package. The bag in which it was in protected the materials from reaching the box. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Once informed of the possible damage. The Hazmat was isolated in the hazmat cage. Package was opened up and damage was confirmed.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023100261
item.description:
Report X-2023100261

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler saw hazmat package was wet and leaking and informed a QA/Admin that was walking the dock. Admin immediately used absorbent to stop the leak from spreading. QA then went to retrieve a hazmat tote and bag and placed leaky hazmat package inside the hazmat bag with the cleanup absorbent, and then placed the bag inside the hazmat tote. DescribePack: The sealant on 3/4 of the bottles inside the package looks like they corroded and caused seal to break and hazmat liquid to slowly leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent was used to stop spread of leak. The leaky hazmat package was then placed inside a hazmat bag with absorbent and cleanup absorbent, and bag was placed inside a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023100260
item.description:
Report X-2023100260

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-26
  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in transit to being loaded into a trailer, when the package fell off the roller/rail which caused HazMat spill. Absorbent power was used immediately as soon as the spill was discovered, cleaned up the absorbent, placed in a red HazMat tote, separated by the leaking package in another HazMat tote. DescribePack: Contents were being transported inside a bucket in a fiberboard box, the cover of the bucket cracked from the sides of it, causing contents to spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent powder was used to control the spill. All absorbent used was placed in a separate HazMat tote and will be disposed of accordingly.

item.title: Report X-2023090450
item.description:
Report X-2023090450

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-30
  • City: MONTEREY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: FedEx packages marked with a flammable GHS label and UN1170 was offered for transportation to our station location in Monterey CA. Before packages could be offered to the local DG specialist for rejection, package was seen to be leaking allowing an estimated 10ml to escape. Spill was cleaned and placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was contacted to retrieve package as it was not properly prepared for transport.

item.title: Report X-2023100493
item.description:
Report X-2023100493

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager called me on the radio informing their was a damage with paint spilling out of it on the belt. Manager quickly put the damaged box into a non-haz bag and then we put the damaged package into a lined bin. DescribePack: So the package does have a hole towards the top corner seam of the package but it is unclear if that is what caused the spill inside the package. There was however a lot of room for the cans of paint to move around in the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As stated before, the damaged package was immediately placed into a non-haz bag and placed into a lined bin after that. There was some spilled areas where the package handlers were loading so those areas were wiped down or soaked up with absorbent pads.

item.title: Report X-2023090173
item.description:
Report X-2023090173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: FRENCH CAMP
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UMXU 250548 was observed with a leak from the bottom of the container. 1-gallon of UN1090, flammable liquid, Acetone leaked from a cracked 5-gallon drum, 1 of 20 pieces on a pallet with no blocking and bracing. The drum was overpacked, stopping the release.

item.title: Report X-2023090172
item.description:
Report X-2023090172

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ETCX 21082 was observed leaking from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). The leak point is at 1 of 8 bolts on the BOV flange. The bolt torque was checked and determined to be correct. Therefore, the BOV flange gasket is defective. Containment has been placed on/under the BOV and the shipper is arranging a transfer.

item.title: Report X-2023090086
item.description:
Report X-2023090086

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-27
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was brough to the attention of the spill office located at out Oakland Hub location when it was seen package was leaking what appeared to be a gray paint on to the belts during sort operations. Package was packed in a fibreboard box without DG markings. There did appear to be old labels torn off the box before transport. Inspection of contents found a Rust*oleum Epoxy Shield 2 part garage floor coating kit. SDS of product indicated product is regulated for travel on aircraft. There was no moisture barrier in the box or positive closure on the cans. Brown paper was used for dunnage. Paper work in the package indicated shipment should have been offered for travel with FedEx Ground. Package placed in a steel salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023090017

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 2 plastic bottles UN3082 in fibreboard outer package. one bottle leaked. per SDS it shows as regulated material. spill cleaned locally and secured in salvage drum for FAA inspection onsite.

item.title: Report X-2023081416
item.description:
Report X-2023081416

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-09T00:32:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: BARSTOW
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: GATX 206280 was identified by CA PUC Inspector with a drip from BOV Cap. Responders tightened the cap quarter turn as was initially loose and cycled the valve and monitored for the continued release. The release did not cease and the cap was removed with thread sealant applied to the threads of the BOV Cap with the release secured and car was monitored for any further release with none identified.
